entry.RedBlue: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
entry.Yellow: If it senses any danger, it will vigorously spray water or a special type of ink from its mouth.
entry.Gold: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its dorsal fin.
entry.Silver: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
entry.Crystal: When they're in a safe location, they can be seen playfully tangling their tails together.
entry.Ruby: HORSEA eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this POKéMON anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
entry.Sapphire: If HORSEA senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This POKéMON swims by cleverly flapping the fins on its back.
entry.FireRed: It maintains balance using its tail, which is wound up like a coil. It may spray ink from its mouth.
entry.LeafGreen: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
entry.Emerald: By cleverly flicking the fins on its back side to side, it moves in any direction while facing forward. It spits ink to escape if it senses danger.
entry.DiamondPearlPlatinum: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
entry.HeartGold: If attacked by a larger enemy, it quickly swims to safety by adeptly controlling its well-developed dorsal fin.
entry.SoulSilver: Its big, developed fins move rapidly, allowing it to swim backward while still facing forward.
entry.BlackWhiteBlack 2White 2: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
entry.X: Known to shoot down flying bugs with precision blasts of ink from the surface of the water.
entry.Y: It makes its nest in the shade of corals. If it senses danger, it spits murky ink and flees.
entry.Omega Ruby: Horsea eats small insects and moss off of rocks. If the ocean current turns fast, this Pokémon anchors itself by wrapping its tail around rocks or coral to prevent being washed away.
entry.Alpha Sapphire: If Horsea senses danger, it will reflexively spray a dense black ink from its mouth and try to escape. This Pokémon swims by cleverly flapping the fin on its back.

FireRed: Route 4, 10, 11, 12, 13, 19, 20, 21, 24, Bond Bridge, Cerulean City, Cinnabar Island, Five Island, Five Isle Meadow, Green Path, Icefall Cave, Kindle Road, Memorial Pillar, One Island, Outcast Island, Pallet Town, Resort Gorgeous, Seafoam Islands, Tanoby Ruins, Trainer Tower, Treasure Beach, Vermilion City, Water Labyrinth, Water Path
LeafGreen: Route 4, 10, 11, 12, 13, 19, 20, 21, 24, Cerulean City, Cinnabar Island, Pallet Town, Seafoam Islands, Vermilion City
